Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but very poorly managed”
Reviews.Author: Keith S
Reviews.Content: The staff are nice but they are poorly trained, I was charged for all sorts of things that I did not have, external laundry, Internet cards that I paid for in cas and then was charged to the room. My wife stayed with me for 6 nights but they charged me for 8 nights. Tip of the day .... Do not use the bar downstairs it is very smokey and expensive, go over the road to the docks bar in the ramada they have nice reasonable priced food and the drinks are cheaper, better still take a right out of the hotel and go to the Boston bar in the Rotana it has an Irish theme and a happy hour every day until 8 pm Would I stay there again ....................no way

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as these reviews make out”
Reviews.Author: MikeJefferies
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three times now, and while I'd struggle to call the place "great", it's not bad at all. I've never had any issue with hot water, room has always been clean, and never heard anything from the disco downstairs. Breakfast is ok, but there's not much choice for a westerner. There's a small mall about 10 minutes walk away, with a Carrefour supermarket there. The chinese restaurant downstairs is very good. There's a small fitness room on the top floor, couple of treadmills, step machine, etc. The room can get very warm though, so take a water bottle with you.

Reviews.Title: “Do not plan to return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MTravel84
Reviews.Content: A couple of friends and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and have decided that we shall not be returning in the future. We usually travel to Dubai every month for 2 nights and I usually stay at the Marriott however this time we opted to stay at the Capitol because a friend of ours lives just a few blocks down the street. We booked 4 rooms and at check in everything went smoothly. The only thing we noticed is that the staff does not know what it means to smile and greet guests… anyways. The rooms were clean however two of our rooms didn't have warm water in the shower so we had to shower in the rooms with warm water. (One of my friends who’s stayed in this hotel before told me he had the same shower problem the last time so perhaps the hotel should look into their piping system since warm water is not exactly an "Extra service”). One of the biggest issues we had was when we returned to the hotel in the night. One of the night staff decided it was necessary to follow us all the way to the lift and repeatedly ask "are you guest’s" which we all answered yes however he still followed us. He was directing his questions to the females in the group which made us realize he must have thought we were "working girls". Now while this issue might be a big problem in Dubai that does not mean the hotel gets to harass their female guests. On the second night all the girls in the group held their room keys in their hands as soon as we left the taxi so that we were not harassed and followed all the way to the lift. If the hotel insists on following guests around perhaps they should print a list with the names of in house guests and make sure that all guests who enter the hotel tell their name and room number (even though this would also be seen as delving into people’s personal lives…it seems better than having a man follow you and repeatedly ask the same question). When I travel I feel that I am paying with my hard earned money and therefore should feel comfortable and safe which I did not therefore, we have decided that another hotel in Dubai deserves our business. The hotel should look at the number of females booking the hotel because I am pretty sure that if their night staff treats all their female guests as they did us I am pretty sure they would notice female bookings are not that high. (I am not sure if our group was a special case...but we were dressed appropriately for the region and behaved in an orderly fashion since I have lived in the middle east for 27 years). While the Marriott might be a little more out of the way from the places we visit in Dubai and costly we decided that we will spend the extra taxi and hotel money in order to feel comfortable rather than being made to feel cheap. (I never had this issue in the Marriott..too bad that the Capitol will be losing out on our monthly visits of at least 4-6 rooms for at least 2 nights).

Reviews.Title: “Price is reasonable but it is not 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mahsa_USA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Capital hotel in Jan 2012 as group of 10 people and although the staffs were polite but they always made many silly mistakes , for example I asked 3 times to send someone fix our bath hot water and during 4 days no body come , hot water in bathroom is not really warm and you can not take shower . Also I asked for booking airport transfer at 10 AM for 10 PM and in 10 PM shift was changed and nobody knows about our booking .Although a person who was in charge of service called the taxi and try his best but we lost some time for waiting , Disco sound even in second flour makes you to do not sleep till 3 Am , so be ready for that :) Breakfast was good and room was clean . It is far from metro station and you need to take a taxi for about 10-13 AED .

Reviews.Title: “Good night club's and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: aetos1
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, great rooms, but the area around the hotel has no any interesting . However the hotel with the cool night clubs and restaurants provides an opportunity to have a really good nights, with the SAVAGE GARDEN Latin American Tavern and the CZAR CLUB Russian Night Club The BAZERKAN Lebanese Restaurant and the IMPERIAL GARDEN Chinese Restaurant provide very good dinners The mini Bar is full and the bathroom very clean The internet connection is not so fast and very expensive General is very good hotel for a busines trip with logical prices

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: yobled30
Reviews.Content: do not stay here if you want to sleep at night. The hotel features 2 night clubs on the ground floor and an extremely loud restaurant/belly dancing on the top floor. The hotel itself is not a 4 star neither for the structure nor for the service. The staff is polite but that's about it, no extra effort is made and silly mistakes are repeted daily. The hotel advertises internet availability in the rooms, but only few have it and its not cheap either! the pool is tiny and the location is poor. it might seem like a good deal but its definitly notunless you are a single man looking for fun a night and sleep during the day!

Reviews.Title: “An Emirates stopover night from hell”
Reviews.Author: Phill S
Reviews.Content: We got bumped to this hotel overnight as the Copthorne was full. Arrived 1am, and put on the first floor. I complained about the loud music thumping in my room from the night club, and told it would end at 3am and no other rooms were available. The base was very intense and hard core party. I used ear-plugs but these were rather useless.I complained to the manager who promised it would end at 3am. I went down to the manager at 3.30am who said it would be immediately stopped. At 4am it did stop. I had to be up at 6:30am for my next 14 hour long haul flight. I wish i had stayed at the airport. The room itself was fairly run-down and smelt damp and musty.

Reviews.Title: “Loud music keeps you awake”
Reviews.Author: KateDavy
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favourite hotels, cheap and friendly but I am going to stop staying here as the music is too loud. From 11pm till well after 3am we are kept awake with music from the Bollywood club. Repeated complaints to front desk did not help. Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel value for money”
Reviews.Author: amigo123
Reviews.Content: A well-located good 4 star hotel with clean environment and decent service. The only minus was loud music on the terrace which was subdued after constant complaints to the manager. They however charge for the internet in the room and no Wi-Fi facility. A good and inexpensive Chinese restaurant Chin Chin is just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, dank and smelling of cigarette”
Reviews.Author: Welkom12
Reviews.Content: The website states that the Capitol is a 4 star deluxe hotel. I would rank this hotel between 1 and 2 stars. The breakfast is poor and not worth getting out of bed for. Rooms on the lower floors are noisy due to the nightclubs at the rear and sides of the hotel. Loud thumping music goes on until 3 am. The hotel faces a busy road and sound insulation is not good. The girls on reception are not particularly friendly, unapologetic and indifferent to reports of sleepless nights. The rooms appear jaded as does the rest of the hotel. Cigarette smells are present even in the non smoking rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Appropriate for singles and family interested in night club and disco”
Reviews.Author: Mohammad101010
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located far from downtown but in a good area of Barr dubai and also near to jumarah beach and some to extent near to wild wadi and arab tower. Also this hotel has two night club one arabian and another one from south america which are good but the prices are so high especially for those man interested to have a business lady in their room. It must be mentioned that despite the regulations, it is allowed to bring lady in your room at night, indentification card or vissa is necessary to have. The quality of breakfast is also good but it is not possible to bring that in food by hotel personnel. Totally this hotel is recommended to singles and married people which are interested in night clubs and disco and beach.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SamHuss
Reviews.Content: The other reviwer most certainly got it right. This is not a familly hotel. At the flick of a switch at night, this hotel felt literally the town's main bordello. The management regulary charges room's by the hour and the reception is a veritable feast of characters. Within minutes of being in the room. A knock on the door, turned out to be a thai prostitude dressed in black. No doubt send in by the reception. I complained later on, but they looked at me, as if I was mad. Little did I know this of course. I just wanted a cheap room and I got it. A very basic toilet and tv and that is it. Door locks are not secure. So don't dare to leave anything valuable inside. Walls are thin, so you can imagine what you hear. I checked after one night and found the Awal Hotel, about 5 minutes from this. It is slightly more expensive at about bd15 but it was much better and cleaner. The only plus is the low price and the location if you liked being in the very heart of the old town and souk. At night the area is full of life and people. Sadly good quality cheap hotels in this part of the world is nothing more than hangouts of illrepute. There are plenty of 5 star places but very few in the lower end.

Reviews.Title: “Not a family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kuz1
Reviews.Content: If you are planning on visiting dubai with your family or for a simple holiday they think wisley. The Capitol hotel is mainly for business people. We were the only family there who were not on business. The rooms are spacious and up to date, as well as the hotel. However the hotel does seem tired. The View however in rooms are very poor. We had two rooms, one room had the beautiful brick call to look at with two small windows on either side and the other room had another room to look at. Breakfast is not great as the same food is served day after day. Other hotels i have stayed at have a huge variety but the Capitol doesnt. The guests are all on business so it doesnt make it fun for family. There is no specific hotel evening entertainment, only a couple of bars and a resteraunt which we didnt use at all. the swimming pool is small but fine for a dip, nothing special. while we were out on the roof, we were disrupted by the drilling taking place on the room and all the dust plesantly falling in the pool. If you expect to see other people there then think again, its a dead area on the roof with a shoddy gym facility. The hotel service is fine, but we used the hotel for somewhere to sleep. If u want something special, spend the money and go somewhere else. but if your on business or jus need somewhere to sleep then its fine.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were staying at the Capitol on business and accordingly we spent little time at the hotel other than for sleeping and eating. Our meals were confined to the buffet breakfast, which was always adequate, and dinner in our room-either lamb cutlets or fish with salad which were always enjoyable.Wine is expensive and the choice limited. The room was large and clean- albeit a little dark having a small window facing an adjacent appartment block-and well maintained.Traffic noise was not a problem. There is internet access in the room with the cost being standard. Although we were some distance from the night-club on the floor below, the noise was a problem on at least two nights during our stay. People staying in rooms closer to the night club had difficulty sleeping. Smoke is a problem throughout the hotel, if you are a non-smoker. Although we were in a non-smoking room, we needed to put towels behind the door to prevent smoke from entering our bedroom at night.For us who were on business, the disco and the smoke were the only problems. We did not use the gym or swimming pool and so cannot comment. However, the pool is very small and un-inviting with cloudy water when we visited. Generally, the staff were very friendly and helpful, although one of the customer service representatives was not only unhelpful, but bordering on rude. However, I prefer to remember the lovely people who served us at breakfast with particular mention of the chef who really tried and succeeded in making our eggs perfect. I also need to mention that the hotel did not charge us for a late check-out at 6pm which is a nice gesture. This is not really a tourist hotel in my view. It's away from the beach and the main shopping malls which are definitely worth visiting. It's possibly fine if you are on business or in transit.Another plus is that there is no construction activity in the vicinity of the Capitol.

Reviews.Title: “great bars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was in Dubai for 4 years and when i meet someone took me in Savage Garden. I was there amost every night and was great. I meet great persons like Miss Magda who work in Savage and the waitress. after a wile i went in Xanadu were also it's a great disco. I had great moment in that places. Now i'm in Romania and i wish to visit again ,in one day ur hotel and to have good time. Good luck in the future

Reviews.Title: “Capitol Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel had lots of good points but major disappointment was that there seemed to be no non-smoking rooms. We arrived early in the morning (6.00am) and the hotel was very accommodating, showing us to our room within half an hour of our arrival, however, the room really smelled of stale smoke. This was not an isolated problem as at least one other couple had the same problem, even though they had pre-booked a non-smoking room. We asked to change rooms and was informed that we could, but not until midday. At midday it seemed there was a problem, with only one room available, I fear this room only smelled sweeter due to the fact it was above the night club and had probably been unoccupied for some time. As I was fortunate enough to have ear plugs with me the noise did not prove a problem. The hotel itself was very clean and the staff most pleasant, the food was OK and on a par with other establishments tried, but disappointing and not as good as Singapore, our last port of call. The hotel provided daily shuttles to the beach and to the city for shopping, which was appreciated. In all the hotel was fine and for the cost (a cheap deal through Emirates airlines), is somewhere I would use again.
